act_info.full_title: Education Development Charges Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. D.9
act_info.citation: Education Development Charges Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. D.9

content.content: 1. In this Act, “area municipality” means, (a) a town, other than a separated town, township or village in a county, and (b) a city, town, village or township in a regional, metropolitan or district municipality; (“municipalité de secteur”) “development” includes redevelopment; (“exploitation”) “municipality” means a city, town, village, township, improvement district or county or a regional, metropolitan or district municipality; (“municipalité”) “Municipal Board” means the Ontario Municipal Board; (“Commission des affaires municipales”) “prescribed” means prescribed by regulations made under this Act; (“prescrit”) “upper tier municipality” means a county or a regional, metropolitan or district municipality. (“municipalité de palier supérieur”)  R.S.O. 1990, c. D.9, s. 1; 1997, c. 27, s. 69 (2).
content.raw_html:
1. In this Act,

“area municipality” means,

(a) a town, other than a separated town, township or village in a county, and

(b) a city, town, village or township in a regional, metropolitan or district municipality; (“municipalité de secteur”)

“development” includes redevelopment; (“exploitation”)

“municipality” means a city, town, village, township, improvement district or county or a regional, metropolitan or district municipality; (“municipalité”)

“Municipal Board” means the Ontario Municipal Board; (“Commission des affaires municipales”)

“prescribed” means prescribed by regulations made under this Act; (“prescrit”)

“upper tier municipality” means a county or a regional, metropolitan or district municipality. (“municipalité de palier supérieur”)  R.S.O. 1990, c. D.9, s. 1; 1997, c. 27, s. 69 (2).

content.content: 2. The Minister of Education and Training is responsible for the administration of this Act.  1997, c. 27, s. 69 (3). Part I Repealed:  1997, c. 27, s. 69 (4). Part II Repealed:  1997, c. 27, s. 69 (4). Part III Repealed:  1997, c. 31, s. 147 (2). PART IV   GENERAL 44., 45. Repealed:  1997, c. 27, s. 69 (6).
content.raw_html:
2. The Minister of Education and Training is responsible for the administration of this Act.  1997, c. 27, s. 69 (3).

Part I Repealed:  1997, c. 27, s. 69 (4).

Part II Repealed:  1997, c. 27, s. 69 (4).

Part III Repealed:  1997, c. 31, s. 147 (2).

PART IV
GENERAL

44., 45. Repealed:  1997, c. 27, s. 69 (6).

content.content:
46. (1) A request made before the 23rd day of November, 1989 for a referral under subsection 51 (17) of the Planning Act with respect to a condition relating to a charge related to development shall be continued and disposed of under the Planning Act. Appeals under Planning Act continued (2) An appeal made before the 23rd day of November, 1989 under subsection 53 (7) of the Planning Act
with respect to a condition relating to a charge related to development shall continue and be disposed of under the Planning Act. Conflicts (3) If a decision of the Municipal Board respecting a matter mentioned under subsection (1) or (2) conflicts with a development charge by-law, the decision of the Board prevails to the extent of the conflict.  R.S.O. 1990, c. D.9, s. 46. 47. Repealed:  1997, c. 27, ss. 69 (6).
content.raw_html:
46. (1) A request made before the 23rd day of November, 1989 for a referral under subsection 51 (17) of the Planning Act with respect to a condition relating to a charge related to development shall be continued and disposed of under the Planning Act.

Appeals under Planning Act continued

(2) An appeal made before the 23rd day of November, 1989 under subsection 53 (7) of the Planning Act with respect to a condition relating to a charge related to development shall continue and be disposed of under the Planning Act.

Conflicts

(3) If a decision of the Municipal Board respecting a matter mentioned under subsection (1) or (2) conflicts with a development charge by-law, the decision of the Board prevails to the extent of the conflict.  R.S.O. 1990, c. D.9, s. 46.

47. Repealed:  1997, c. 27, ss. 69 (6).

content.content: 48. Despite section 95 of the Ontario Municipal Board Act, there is no right to file a petition under that section in respect of any order or decision of the Municipal Board made in respect of any matter appealed to the Board under this Act.  R.S.O. 1990, c. D.9, s. 48.
content.raw_html: 48. Despite section 95 of the Ontario Municipal Board Act, there is no right to file a petition under that section in respect of any order or decision of the Municipal Board made in respect of any matter appealed to the Board under this Act.  R.S.O. 1990, c. D.9, s. 48.

content.content: 49. In the event of conflict between this Act and any other general or special Act, this Act prevails.  R.S.O. 1990, c. D.9, s. 49. ______________  Français
content.raw_html:
49. In the event of conflict between this Act and any other general or special Act, this Act prevails.  R.S.O. 1990, c. D.9, s. 49.
